author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Madras High Court has impleaded the National Commission for Scheduled Castes as a party to a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) petition which alleged diversion of funds allotted for the welfare of Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes by the Central government to other welfare schemes of the State government.

The First Bench of Chief Justice S.K. Kaul and Justice M.M. Sundresh passed the order on a PIL plea by M. Selvaraj, state general secretary of the Scheduled Caste Morcha affiliated to the BJP. The petitioner sought a direction to the authorities to furnish the details of the exact amount diverted to other departments from funds allocated by the Union government.

When the plea came up for hearing, directing notice to the commission the Bench posted the plea to June 16 for further hearing.
title: Plea on funds spent for SC/ST welfare
